Description: Fragment of a faience stand with two adjacent triangilar faces. Both decorated in relief, one with an unceratin design, theother with a bird againts a lattice. Bright blue glaze.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Memphis (Egypt), From the south end of Memphis on the site of the kilns.
Acquisition notes: 1997.10-1.1-22 and 1997 10-2.1 are almost certainly the unregistered residue of the material registered in the British and Medieval Dept as 1910.11-16.4-70. I f so, then it was given by the British School of Archaeology in Egypt, and described as being from the south end of Memphis on the site of the kilns.
